summary:
Mali is a large, landlocked country in West Africa, with 13 official languages. It's known for its history as a powerful empire and a center of trade and Islam. The country has a young population, with almost half under 15. The economy relies on agriculture and mining, especially gold. 

In recent years, Mali has faced political unrest, including military coups and an armed conflict in the north with Tuareg rebels. France intervened in 2013 to help regain control. Mali is working towards stability and democratic rule.
title: Mali
